description: In the Scottish highlands of the early 1970s, Bess, a spiritually committed Calvinist, directs her passions toward her new husband, Jan, an oil rigger. When an accident on an offshore platform leaves Jan paralyzed, he makes requests of Bess that test the limits of her piety and devotion.
title: Breaking the Waves
text:
Watch ... for Emily Watson’s raw, unguarded performance. Director Lars von Trier, inspired by “The Passion of Joan of Arc,” the silent classic by his Danish countrymen Carl Theodor Dreyer, offers Bess (Watson) as pure of heart and a little deranged, the last true innocent in a corrupt world that seems determined to break her down. Von Trier puts Bess — and the audience — through the wringer in a bid to achieve transcendence.
Skip ... because the road to transcendence is paved with sadism. Von Trier is among the most polarizing directors in the world, and “Breaking the Waves” left many questioning the purpose of his torments.
